importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication reflects the current timeline of Doug Martin's passing, which is a significant event in the context of NFL history and public mourning.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe from 2012 to 2018 covers Martin's active NFL career, during which he played for the Buccaneers and Raiders, and achieved major milestones such as Pro Bowl selections and All-Pro honors.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft after a standout college career at Boise State.
He rushed for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns over six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin earned a Pro Bowl berth in 2012 and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015.
He had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in the Buccaneers' franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration.
The Buccaneers and his family confirmed the death as sudden and unexpected, with the cause of death still unconfirmed.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and a standout college player from Boise State, died at the age of 36. He was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft and went on to rush for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns over seven seasons, earning Pro Bowl honors in 2012 and 2015, and first-team All-Pro recognition in 2015. Martin also had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards. The Buccaneers mourned his sudden and unexpected passing, honoring him as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration. The cause of death remains unconfirmed.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
